cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northeast on Wednesday and accelerate northeastward across GA/SC on Thursday, then trace the mid-Atlantic coastline toward New Jersey and New England late Thursday night through Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: North Florida Gulf Coast (near Steinhatchee River)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch north of Altamaha Sound GA to South Santee River SC (well south of NJ)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Dry Tortugas FL northward along west coast of FL to Ochlockonee River and the GA coast to Altamaha Sound
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from Florida Big Bend through the Carolinas to New England, including New Jersey shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Breezy to windy conditions possible late Thu night–Fri with peak sustained winds 25–35 mph and gusts to 45 mph as Elsa’s center passes nearby
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water level rises of 1 ft or less possible along Delaware Bay and back bays during high tide Friday
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain late Thu night through Fri could total 2–3 in., producing ponding on terminal surfaces and brief visibility reductions
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated brief tornadoes cannot be ruled out Friday, and thunderstorm-related lightning may cause short cargo-handling stoppages
